column1: Oh Gerald, it's beautiful.
Oh it's gorgeous. These old houses are so neat.
No! Hello, how are you?
Why would Family Guy so blatantly insult Muslims?
Kyle? Kyle, what are you watchi-?!
Gaaah! It's Family Guy! Quick, Gerald, do something!
You boys know you're not supposed to watch that careless show!
You boys don't understand anything! It's obvious that you ALL need Muslim-sensitivity training!
Wait a minute!  Where's Ike?!
Ike!
Hello bubbe, how was school today?
Oh, come on, school isn't all that bad.
Whatwhatwhaaat?!
We have to do something! It is obvious our children are still completely confused about 9-11!
Mr. Mackey, there are more important things going on here!
Kyle, I need you to go get your brother over at his teacher's house.
Tell his teacher I'm sorry, but I forgot he has a doctor's appointment today.
He's been going there in the afternoons for private tutoring.
Miss Stevenson? Yes. She's very nice.
That's great.
Yes, Ike, you like Spider-Man, don't you?
Mommy loves you too, sweetie.
Sex? Oh bubbe, Ike is much too young.
Help! Please, I need your help! That teacher, Miss Stevenson, she, she left town with my son! I got a note saying they're going to Milan!
No, it's true!
This is serious!
Are you going to do nothing?!
Hello?
Ohh, hello, Mrs. Cartman.
Excuse me?
Our son is a good kid. He just didn't understand Tourette's was a real disease.
Oh, thank you Eric.
Kyle, leprechauns aren't real. You're almost nine now; you need to understand the difference beween real and imaginary.
Oh,hello Eric.  Kyle, your friend is here.
Whatwhatwhat?!
Kyle, what's the matter? You barely touched your knishes.
Wwwhat? That's ridiculous. My little bubbeleh is adorable!
You're not ugly, Kyle. You're my perfect little man. You look just like your father.
Kyle, you are very handsome and perfect in every way.
Kyle, come back here!
There there, bubbe, you'll be okay.  Oh doctor, did you find anything? Is it strep?
Oh, well there's a relief.
No, why?
Doctor, what are you saying?
HIV?
No, that's impossible!
Kyle? Kyle!
Hey Sharon, Randy, great harvest, huh?
Kids are doing this?
Huh?  Oh my God...
Don't lie to us, Kyle!
Gerald, what are we gonna do? Our son is a cat pee addict!
What are you gonna do?
Gerald?!
Don't touch me.
Oh my God.
That's exactly why I told Kyle not to hang around that boy.
Obviously Craig has gotten them into some kind of trouble.
Kyle!  Kyle, you have to stop this!
No-o Kyle, you'll be in debt for the rest of your life!  Please, somebody, get him to sto-o-op!
Oh God! Oh God, what did we do wrong, Gerald?!
Oh Kyle, he's gone! Your little brother's run away from home!
He left a note saying he's never coming back.
Oh Gerald, what are we gonna do?
Oh yes, Gerald! I've been so naughty!  Ah, oh, oh, oh jeez! Oh!
Gerald, what has gotten into him?
We've all read the book now and it is very shocking to say the least.
We were actually so moved by your book, Butters, that we brought Mr. Needlebaum from Penguin Publishing to read it.
How about a Halloween costume with one of those plastic masks?
Where did you hear that?
A new family moved in? Where are they from?
New Jersey? A family from New Jersey moved in next to the Marshes?
Oh, God. Poor Sharon. Doesn't she know?
Never invite a New Jersey housewife in your home.
Let go of her, you piece of trash!
All you trashy whores get the fuck out of here and leave her alone!
No! You're a psycho bitch, psycho bitch! Psycho bitch! You wanna see fuckin' crazy?! You'd better just step the fuck away or you're gonna see fuckin' crazy!
That won't work. You can't just tell people from Jersey you don't like them. No matter how obnoxious they are, they will convince themselves that you all actually think they're cool.

That's when I knew I had to tell everyone the truth: that originally I'm from Jersey.  Yes, born and raised, I wasn't even called Sheila back then. In Jersey I was known as S-Woww Tittybang.  I drank heavily and punched a lot of bitches in the face.  Living in South Park, I'm able to control the Jersey side of me, which doesn't really come out unless I get around other people from Jersey.  I'm just really hoping that people here don't judge me for it, or, somehow, you know, hold it against me.
You wouldn't understand. It's a Jersey thing.
Kyle? You in there?
Kyle, open the door.
Kyle, this instant! One, two.
I guess we need to talk.
I know this has to be very upsetting for you, Kyle.

When I got pregnant with you, Kyle, your father and I were living with my parents in Newark. We knew we had to get out. Neither of us wanted our child to be from Jersey, so we moved. As far away as we could. But now I realize you can take the fetus out of Jersey, but you can't take Jersey out of the fetus.
I'm saying that for the first two months I carried you in my stomach, I lived in Newark. Technically, you are from Jersey.
It isn't so bad, Kyle. A lot of people think the Jersey look is nice.
Sharon, I'm so sorry.
Well, if it'll make you feel better about yourself, then work out, Sharon.
There are plenty of things you can buy to get a good workout at home. Have you heard of the Shake Weight?
What's good about a bunch of crap sounds to a drumbeat?
No, no, hold on. If the seat can't raise up the men will just pee all over it.

Yes, yes, this whole coming week is the Jewish holiday of Passover. Yes, it's all about how Moses led the Hebrews out of Egypt. Very good! So on Friday, all Jewish people will celebrate Passover with a seder dinner.  Because God commanded the Jews to only eat bread that hasn't been given yeast to rise.
Yes, yes, one week from seder dinner on Friday to the next Friday.
Well, because in ancient Egypt, God passed over the houses marked with the blood of a lamb.
Well, you're very welcome.
Oh dear, did the Cialis commercial turn you on again?
Oh, Gerald...
Oh, hello.
Oh, dear, but I'm barely dressed.
Oh, you're so rough with me, Mr. UPS man!
Oh yes!
Do it harder, UPS man!
That's right, Kyle.
Oh, Kyle, your little brother is, getting older. He's not a baby anymore.
It's natural, bubbe. Part of getting older is finding ways to assert your independence. You know. Why don't you go and try to talk to him - you can win him over again.
Hi bubbe.
What is it, Kyle?
Sure. You bet.
Kyle, Bill Cosby is here to see you.
Yes.
Yes.
Oh Kyle! Your hash tag is really trending. I saw the commercial.
He's upstairs playing with all his friends.
Kyle, bubbe, what are you watching?
What is this?  It's horrible!
What did he say?
Whatwhatwhaaat?!!?  Young man, you are not to watch that show anymore! It's immature toilet humor!
Oh really? Is that so?
And I myself was not aware of this horrible show until recently. I have a clip to demonstrate exactly what I mean.
Now apparently, that's supposed to be funny.
Not allowing our kids to watch this show is not enough. We need to boycott the entire network! All those in favor...
These boys minds have been tainted by the garbage on television that they see, and we are fed up!
We have to stop this smut from going on the air. We will march to the network and protest until our demands are met. New York, here we come!
We are spreading the word to this establishment that we demand better television, for our children!  We want more quality television, like Full House.
It'll work, it has to.
Hey, you will not get away with this!  That does it, no more Mr. Nice Protesters. It's time for 'Plan B'.
Over there hon. What, you need to drop some friends off at the pool?

The network is not taking us seriously. In the past, people have had to die for what they believed in, and we are prepared to do the same. Ready?  Mr. McCormick, you shall be a martyr to us all. God Speed. We will not let these corporate half-wits ruin our children's minds. Launch!  We will all follow suit, one by one if that's what it takes.
Here Carol, I think it's your boy.
At last, now we can return to normality.
Here they are!
But look what they put on.
What did he say?
Whatwhatwhaaat!!!  Come on everybody, back to New York!
Mr. Garrison, what the hell do you think you're doing?!
How dare you include the Nativity in a school play?  Don't you realize my son is Jewish?!
So what makes you think he should play Joseph of Arimathea?
Our family doesn't celebrate Christmas.
Whatwhatwhaaat?!? You're not going to get away with this, Mr. Garrison!!
How about the dreidl song, bubbe?
Kyle, that is enough!
Now that does it! I'm going straight to the mayor about you, Mr Garrison.
That isn't all, Mayor!  The school play is doing a Nativity scene!  It isn't being sensitive to the Jewish community!
Kyle!  Sshhh!
Okay, Kyle, we're leaving right nowww.
Your father's right, Kyle.
Listen to your father, Kyle.
This is for your own good, bubbe.
Oh my God!
Whatwhatwhaaat?!  Me?!
Oh, this could be such a wonderful Christmas play - I wish our little Kyle was here to see it
What the hell is this???  This is horrible!!!
We can't even leave our homes for fear of our children's safety.
Just a little higher.
Oh, hi, bubele. I'm glad you're here; you can help decorate for the party.
To celebrate your little brother's  passage into life.
It's Jewish tradition, bubbe.
Oy, what is the matter with them?
Bubbe, where have you been? Dinner's been ready for five minutes.
How is my little jellybean?
Okay, but first let Mommy give you a kiss.
Aaaaargh! Omigod, make him stop!
My baby! Oh, God, the horror!
Ooooohhhhhhooh-ho! Oooh, my baby! Bubbeleh mine!  Waagghh!!  My baby!!
Oh, he's dead, he's dead! My little bubbeleh's dead!
Well, bubbe, there's something you have to know. Ike wasn't really your brother, he was adopted.
What are you talking about?
What-what-whaaat?!
Now, where did you leave him, young man?
Gerald! Do something about your smart-ass son!
If we don't find him, so help me, you're gonna be grounded for a month!  Ike, love?
Excuse me, we're looking for a two-year-old Canadian boy.
Come on!
Ike!
But first, apologize to your brother!
Hello, Tom. Hello, Patty. Thanks for coming to Ike's bris.
Look Ike, It's Uncle Murray!
He's been sent to his room for being a bastard. He's decided that Ike isn't his brother, since he's adopted.
Hello. Do I know you?
Ohhh, thanks.
Hello, Dr. Schwartz! Thank you so much for coming all this way to perform Ike's bris.
Right over here.
Kyle, what are you talking about?
Kyle! That is enough! I've been reading up on your poor nurse's condition, and it is nothing to be made fun of. It's called "conjoined twin myslexia".

Now, that's just the kind of unawareness that we need to fight against. Sit down, boys.  You see boys, sometimes, when babies are born, they're born as twins. But sometimes the twins get hooked together, and they're born as Siamese twins.

But sometimes, after the Siamese twins are joined together, one of the twins dies before birth. The living baby is born with the dead baby still attached.  Sometimes, this dead twin is inside the living person, so even you could have a dead twin inside you and not even know it!
So now that you're educated about her disease, you won't need to make fun of her. Right, bubbe?
Can you imagine that poor, poor woman?
Feeling like an outcast, being ridiculed every day...
Hello?
Oh, yes. Hello, Sharon.
Well, Sharon, I was just trying to educate them about conjoined twin myslexia.
That does it! I must educate the entire town about this awful disease!
Nothing is pissing me off! I just wanta start a movement.
I want to talk to you all about your school nurse.
No, no no. I'm not upset about her. I want to make the public aware of her. Her disease should be brought to light so that it can be understood rather than made fun of.
She has a dead fetus attached to her head.
Well, that's exactly what I'm talking about. This poor woman is forced to live in the shadows because she feels like an outcast. It is up to us to make her feel comfortable and welcome in our town!
I want to invite your nurse to a dinner party at my house this evening. I'd appreciate it if both you and Mr. Mackey would attend.
Wonderful!
So, uhh, where did you get your degree, Nurse Gollum?
Ahhh.
Gerald!  Keep your damn mouth shut!
Please forgive us. I-I'm terribly sorry, Nurse Gollum.
I have felt so bad ever since I heard the boys making fun of you--
Yes, we could get you a few hats and wear a different one every day. No big whoop.
I've got it! We could set aside a whole week to make the public aware of folks just like you.
Ooooh, this is so exciting! I'm gonna get the mayor on the phone right now!
Dammit, Kyle! We've been working all week against that kind of behavior!
She's really touched.
Yeah, the nerve of some people.
Oy, I knew I shouldn't have made Kyle eat that gefukahukah.
It's only a matter of time before they're selling their bodies and buying smack.
Bubbeleh you need to get to bed! It's late!
Well, hurry up!
My God, I never knew chickenpox was such a dangerous illness.
That's not crazy at all, Sharon. Mothers do it all the time.
Noo, no. And I'm pretty sure that strange little boy Kenny has the chickenpox right now.
How would you boys like to have a little slumber party at your friend Kenny's house tonight?
I don't understand it. He's perfectly healthy.
Are you sure you stayed over at Kenny's house?
Did you sleep in the same room?
Bubbe, how would you like to spend the night at your friend Kenny's house again?
Well I think you need to spend more time with your friends.
I'm gonna give Mrs. McCormick a call.
No, bubbeleh. You play with Kenny some more.
I've got a great game for you. It's called "ookie mouth".
First, you let Kenny spit in your mouth. Then you try to swallow his spit and say "ookie mouth" at the same time.
No, no, bubbe, it's loads of fun. Try it.  That ought to take care of it.
Oh, no thank you. It's terrific though, it's-- You don't have any tea bags or coffee grounds to go in the hot water, do you?
I see. Well, you certainly have aab- humble home, Mrs. McCormick.
Oh, I'm sorry to hear that.
Try again, bubbe!
You know, your husband and mine used to work together as teenagers.
Really? I met Gerald in college, so I didn't know. What happened to them?
Well that's too bad. I'm sure your husband's a fine man.
But if they were such good friends it seems silly that they don't even talk anymore. Let's get them together!
We'll just arrange a little fishing trip for them or something.
Practice makes perfect, bubbe.
No I don't understand it, Dr. Schwartz, he's perfectly healthy.  He's been over at Kenny's house three days in a row and still hasn't caught the chickenpox.
I don't know what else to do. We sent the other boys over and they all got sick, but I can't get my little Kyle to catch it.
Kyle, what are you doing there, honey?
I'll call you back, Dr. Schwartz.
What, bubbeleh, what is it?
Oy. It was for your own good, Kyle. I wanted you to get chickenpox while you were young.
Now, Kyle, come here.
Hoh boy.
So how was it? Did you boys have a good time fishing?
Catch anything?
Well, darling, I have to tell you something. He didn't invite you. I set the whole thing up.
I thought it would be good for you.
I'm doing the best I can!
Oh good, maybe you finally caught the chicken--
Kyle!!
And how are you, Kyle?
What-what-whaaat?! You did this?!
It's true. We were wrong for deceiving you about it.
Kyle, what are you doing here?! This is very dangerous!
Kyle, get back into the carnival this instant! You can't be out in the street!
Okay, here!
Oy..! Thank you, Chef.
Oh, of course!  Here you go.  Leaving so soon?
Well, best of luck to you, then.
Pretty much what I expected.
It's so nice of you to take all the boys with you.
Goodbye, bubbe! Be careful!
Be safe, Kyle. Bring me something back from the rainforest.
Oh, I didn't realize.
It's okay,  I'll just call some 20-year old and have him come over.
I'm just kidding.
Why?
Kyle.
We have a very strange little boy, Gerald.
Hello there. Who's the cute baby? Who's the fuzzy, huh? Yes, that's a cutie.
Behold, the miracle of childbirth!
It looks quite inviting.
No hot tub for me!
Hold still, Ike! We have to get you dressed! Where the heck is Kyle?
Kyle!
Go get the door, Kyle!
...Uhwell, Kyle, Jewbilee is sort of a ...special thing.
No, no, you're very special, Kenny. It's just that... well, Jewbilee is... for Jewish kids.
Kyle, eh, the problem is...
Come on, Ike!  It's time to go to Squirts!
You have to be in Squirts if you're too young to be a Jew Scout.
Don't worry, Kenny. I'll fill you in on our faith on the way up there.

And then, Kenny, Abraham's wife bore him no children. She had a handmaid, an Egyptian, whose name was Hagar. And Sarai said unto Abraham, "Behold now, the Lord hath restrained me from bearing. I pray thee, go into my maid."
Abraham begat Isaac, who the Lord then said to kill. But that was just a little silly trick to see if Abraham would do it.
Ike, you behave!
Oh my God, what is that?!
This retreat really is out of the way, isn't it?
I'm sure they are.
Good-bye, boys. Kyle and Ike, you be safe. And Kenny?
Try and act Jewish.
What's a Chinpokomon?
Well, why do you need one?
...Well then, the answer is no, Kyle. You just got money to buy your Cyborg Bill doll.
Yeah. We told Kyle he could go if he did all his chores, and he did.
Well, you know how it is, Randy. The more we forbid them to play with Chinpokomons, the more they're gonna love them.
Sure. Apparently, they've been doing these camps in every city around the country; how bad can they be?
But what toy?
How?
Kyle, it's over!
Hold on, kids.
Yes?
Eehh, sure, come in.  What is it?
Defiled? How?
Dug her up? Why??
What?!
Hoh, dear God!
Oooh.
O-o-o-o-oh!
Okay, okay! I get the point! Just tell me what you're gonna do about it!
O-o-ogh!
People stealing bodies to have sex with them? Pirate ghosts destroying the town? When did everything go so wrong?
Well, this is all fine and good, but it doesn't explain what happened to my mother's body!
Hello, boys!
Oh, how precious! You boys are all playing dreidel. Now, you know that dreidel is a time-honored tradition for the Hebrew people.

Now when you learn to make the dreidel spin
You'll know our people always win.
Keep spinning:
Learn
to make the dreidel spin
You'll know
our people always win.
Now when you learn
to make the dreidel spin
You'll know
our people always win.
Keep spinning: learn
to make the dreidel spin
You'll know
our people always win.
We'll talk about this later, Gerald!
Now when you learn
to make the dreidel spin
You'll know
our people always win.
Keep spinning: learn
to make the dreidel spin
You'll know
our people- know our people always win.
Oh, I'm so excited. I've always wanted to see Cirque du Cheville.
Oh, this is so exciting
Oh, that was wonderful!
Sharon, your son has Attention Deficit Disorder too?
I know what you mean. Kyle gets so hyper, sometimes he runs around and screams like a little eight-year-old.
Kyle, Stan and his mother came over to visit you.
They say it's his kidneys. Kyle always has been a diabetic and lately his kidneys have just been shutting down.
I don't know what to do, Sharon. They wanna have him go into surgery, but they're so dangerous.
Really? In People?
Oh, well, with a name like "Miss Information" she must know something.
Okay. I'll get our coats.
Toxins?
You hear that, Kyle? You don't need surgery after all.
Really?
Oh no!
Wow. Well, I am on natural medicines. If only I had known sooner.
Wonderful!
Everything's going to be fine, Stan. We're bringing Kyle in tomorrow to see the Native Americans personally.
Okay, here he is.
But you're more in touch with the earth.
Yes, of course, but we don't have a kidney donor!
How are you feeling, boubbie?
Mr. Garrison, you're a Klan member?
Oh, he's growing up so fast!
Why? What did you do, Kyle?!
Oh noooo, that's just Catholics. Us Jews don't believe in hell.
Well..., Kyle..., they could be wrong, too.
Kyle!
Us Jews don't believe in hell.
It's not that, Kyle. It's just that Eric's mother needs to see you all right away.  Just really quick; she says it's very important.
I sure hope this works.
Hello, Sharon. Where's your husband?
Oh, so did Gerald.
This is "The Miracle Worker"?
No, Kyle.
Kyle, you're not old enough, and those concerts are dangerous and vile.
Alright. Fine, Kyle, you can go to the Raging Pussies concert if you clean out the garage, shovel the driveway and bring democracy to Cuba!
The whole thing.
No you can't!
We know, Kyle, but we just don't want you going to their concert.
Kyle!
Oh my God, this isn't happening. I would never touch my children like that.
Ugh, please, just listen to me!  What about my children? Who will take care of them?
Their grandmother's been dead for three years.  You're not listening to me. Kyle, tell these people that your-  mother never raped you! Tell them! It's my fault. Say it! Tell them right now!!
Oh, Gerald, I haven't seen you for so long!
Oh, it's awful! Just awful.
Kids!
Oh, Kyle. Ike, sweetie, you're OK.
It won't happen again.
It's getting late, boys. Why don't you come on up to bed.
Alright, bubbe.  Oh, and boys? Happy Chanukah.
Oh, he doesn't know that Mitchell slept with his wife, does he?
Look, Gerald. Kyle's on television!
He's able to use comedy to overcome his handicap! I love him!
Ike, eat your gefilte fish.
That's nice, Kyle. Ike, eat!
Well, it's nice to see you so interested in something, Kyle. Ike, for the love of Abraham, you are gonna eat this.
Magic Camp? I don't know, bubbe, ask your father.  Ike, you will eat this!
Ah-ah-ah-I'm afraid Kyle can't ride any amusement park rides for over a year because of his horrible hemorrhoid.
Kyle, don't say such things!
Kyle, we wanna tell you about the Book of Job. It's a story from the Bible.
He was godly, and a good man, and fed the poor.
But one day, Satan went up to Heaven and talked to God.
Yes, in the Book of Job, Satan talks to God. And God says to Satan, "Have you seen Job? He is a great man, and he praises me every day."
To which God said, "Oh yeah? I'll show you, Satan! I'll take those things away from Job and he will still praise my name."
Then God sent his fireballs from the sky and killed his sheep and the rest of his employees.
Job was terribly sad, but he fell to his knees and said, "The Lord giveth, and the Lord taketh away," and praised God's name.
He was in terrible, miserable pain all day, every day. But he still kept his faith.
Basically.
Isn't he getting any better, doctor?
Kyle? Kyle?  Get the doctor!
But then... are you saying...?
Oh Kyle! Kyle, you've got to fight!
Kyle's not going to make it, Stanley. Oh, Gerald!
That's it, baby. That's it.
No, she's right! With all the teen pregnancies that are out today, I think my boy does need to know about sexual education.  From the school.
It's easier to just leave it up to the school, but it's...just not a school subject.
So you mean 17 as long as you're in love?
That's your cousin's flight, Kyle. Hold the sign up nice and high so he can find us.
He's your age and about your height.
Oh, there he is.  Over here, Kyle!
How was your flight?
You remember Uncle Gerry.
And these are your cousins, Ike and Kyle.
Let's get down to the baggage claim, Kyle.
Oooh, that's right! We've got two Kyles now. We'll just call you  Kyle, and you can be Kyle...  Two!
Here we go, Kyle Two.  And here's yours, Kyle.
Oh, I'm so sorry, Kyle. What else can I fix you?
Nonsense. Can't I make you some nice pasta? Or a frozen fish fillet?
I'll put it in the microwave right away.
Yes, Kyle Two?
He's your cousin, Kyle Two. I told you already.
He's my sister's son. That makes him your first cousin.

Now Kyle Two, listen to me. Kyle is going through a very tough time in his life. His mother is very sick and he's in a whole new place. He's going to rely on you to make sure he fits in at your school.
I'm sure your friends will love him.
Kyle Two, he's your responsibility.
I'm sure you two will become great friends with lots of late night pillow talk.
Kyle Two, where is Kyle?
Where on earth could he be?
What?
Don't be ridiculous, Kyle Two. He's out playing with his new friends.
Kyle, what happened to you??
Oh you poor thing! Come upstairs and we'll get you out of those wet clothes.  Are you alright?
Oh, it's been days! Where can he be?
I'm gong to call the police again. Kyle Two, go down to the playground and look there.
Kyle!  You're back!
Now that things have changed for Kyle, his mother needs him back.
I don't get it. He must pull in at least two hundred thousand a year.
I'm going to go take the boys to go see him at the hospital, Eric. We thought you might wanna come.
Yes, it was fabulous!
Well that sounds like a good deal.
Oh, boy! Skiing in Aspen! I can't wait!
Oh, this is gonna be so much fun; I haven't skied in years!
It's lovely. Thank you.
Boys, we have to go to this time-share presentation real quick, but you go meet your ski instructor on the bunny hill.
For only eight thousand dollars we can buy a condo here?
Oh, you know, this is really great.
Thank you.
There you are, boys!
Well, this is ridiculous! I don't know how you raise your kids, but my son does not play negotiator with me!
HA! Give me fifteen seconds with Kyle and I'll have that door open!  Kyle?!  This is your mother! You will open this door right now!
Kyle, if you don't do as you're told, I'm going to be very angry!
AAAAA! Open this door!! Open this door!!
Mmmrragh!!
Let's all just go to bed and let them play their little game for as long as they can.
You're giving them a missile??
All right boys, it's time to go home. You've got some serious grounding time to start.
An abductor in our town?
Yes, we need a barrier to protect our kids.
But who can we get to build it?
What what whaaat?
Oh, boys! Don't ever forget that we love you!
Oh, this is terrible!
Ike? Kyle?
We're sorry, kids. We just let all those sensationalist news reports go to our heads.
Kyle, I think you've bothered the Marshes enough.
Oh, that's so touching.
They just believe in their little hearts that it will work. We can't tell them it won't, we just can't!
Kyle, it's just what some people do.
Oh God, this, this is horrible!
How the hell do you know?!
Oh, this is just great! How could you two be so careless?!
Not without their parents to put it in a proper context! They won't understand what they're seeing!
Boys, we're not mad at you. We just wanna talk to you.
Oh, Gerald, poor Kyle must be just as confused and scared as this poor kid.
This is awful! I just know with every passing minute, little Kyle is seeing more and more depraved sex acts!
Hurry! Hurry!
Oh, Kyle! You're safe!
That's right, but sometimes a woman chooses to use other things. Telephones, staplers, magazines. It's because the nerve endings in the vagina are so sensitive, it's like a fun tickle.
It's also important that you understand why some people choose to urinate on each other.
Yeah, come on boys. Time to get home.
Oh, hi boys.
That's great. We're having our book of the month club meeting, so why don't you boys go outside and play?
Kyle! You know better than to discriminate against homosexuals!
That's right! I think it's time you kids took a little trip to the Museum of Tolerance!
Then it's settled. Boys, you're going to tolerance camp.
Yes. You boys don't know how much we suffered.
